text: hi, is there a way that we can deploy chaincode from binary instead of source code ? If using source code, we have to keep a go run time  environment :joy:
If you have public git repository you can depoly chaincode from there
<@U0NLP5909> it depends on how you are deploying chaincode, for v0.6 it isn't ideal... we are working on improving things considerably for v1.0 but still could be improved.
there's also fabric-chaintool which compiles things into a car file that can be deployed without a local go runtime.
would you recommend go or java for chaincode development. I ask this because I have the impression that Go is far better implemented?
<@U0KM61BCP> thanks for your information, will check
I’m currently able to make HTTP requests from user chaincode. Is this functionality supported by Fabric? Are there any security concerns surrounding this?
